snippet: Lenders involved in the financing of a large leveraged buyout, including Bank of America Merrill Lynch and Morgan Stanley, have decided to delay selling the debt in the face of investor caution.
abstract: Some banks participating in financing of Carlyle Group's takeover of data storage business of Symantec have delayed plans to sell billions of dollars of debt to support deal, underscoring sense of caution prevailing over junk bonds and high-yield loans market; delay also emphasizes how volatile markets have made investors reluctant to place money in bond and equity markets.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED and ALEXANDRA STEVENSON
byline.contributor: Peter Eavis and Leslie Picker contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Lenders involved in the financing of a large leveraged buyout, including Bank of America Merrill Lynch and Morgan Stanley, have decided to delay selling the debt in the face of investor caution.

headline.main: Large Banks Postpone Debt Sale as Investor Appetite for Riskier Loans Wanes
headline.print_headline: Large Banks Postpone Debt Sale as Investor Appetite for Riskier Loans Wanes
